fixedFields.name: openapi
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. This string MUST be the version number of the OpenAPI Specification that the OpenAPI document uses. The openapi field SHOULD be used by tooling to interpret the OpenAPI document. This is not related to the API info.version string.

fixedFields.name: info
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. Provides metadata about the API. The metadata MAY be used by tooling as required.

fixedFields.name: jsonSchemaDialect
fixedFields.description: The default value for the $schema keyword within Schema Objects contained within this OAS document. This MUST be in the form of a URI.

fixedFields.name: servers
fixedFields.description: An array of Server Objects, which provide connectivity information to a target server. If the servers property is not provided, or is an empty array, the default value would be a Server Object with a url value of /.

fixedFields.name: paths
fixedFields.description: The available paths and operations for the API.

fixedFields.name: webhooks
fixedFields.description: The incoming webhooks that MAY be received as part of this API and that the API consumer MAY choose to implement. Closely related to the callbacks feature, this section describes requests initiated other than by an API call, for example by an out of band registration. The key name is a unique string to refer to each webhook, while the (optionally referenced) Path Item Object describes a request that may be initiated by the API provider and the expected responses. An example is available.

fixedFields.name: components
fixedFields.description: An element to hold various schemas for the document.

fixedFields.name: security
fixedFields.description: A declaration of which security mechanisms can be used across the API. The list of values includes alternative security requirement objects that can be used. Only one of the security requirement objects need to be satisfied to authorize a request. Individual operations can override this definition. To make security optional, an empty security requirement ({}) can be included in the array.

fixedFields.name: tags
fixedFields.description: A list of tags used by the document with additional metadata. The order of the tags can be used to reflect on their order by the parsing tools. Not all tags that are used by the Operation Object must be declared. The tags that are not declared MAY be organized randomly or based on the tools' logic. Each tag name in the list MUST be unique.

fixedFields.name: externalDocs
fixedFields.description: Additional external documentation.

fixedFields.name: title
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The title of the API.

fixedFields.name: summary
fixedFields.description: A short summary of the API.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A description of the API. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: termsOfService
fixedFields.description: A URL to the Terms of Service for the API. This MUST be in the form of a URL.

fixedFields.name: contact
fixedFields.description: The contact information for the exposed API.

fixedFields.name: license
fixedFields.description: The license information for the exposed API.

fixedFields.name: version
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The version of the OpenAPI document (which is distinct from the OpenAPI Specification version or the API implementation version).

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.

fixedFields.name: url
fixedFields.description: The URL pointing to the contact information. This MUST be in the form of a URL.

fixedFields.name: email
fixedFields.description: The email address of the contact person/organization. This MUST be in the form of an email address.

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The license name used for the API.

fixedFields.name: identifier
fixedFields.description: An SPDX license expression for the API. The identifier field is mutually exclusive of the url field.

fixedFields.name: url
fixedFields.description: A URL to the license used for the API. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The url field is mutually exclusive of the identifier field.

fixedFields.name: url
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. A URL to the target host.  This URL supports Server Variables and MAY be relative, to indicate that the host location is relative to the location where the OpenAPI document is being served. Variable substitutions will be made when a variable is named in {brackets}.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: An optional string describing the host designated by the URL. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: variables
fixedFields.description: A map between a variable name and its value.  The value is used for substitution in the server's URL template.

fixedFields.name: enum
fixedFields.description: An enumeration of string values to be used if the substitution options are from a limited set. The array MUST NOT be empty.

fixedFields.name: default
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The default value to use for substitution, which SHALL be sent if an alternate value is not supplied. Note this behavior is different than the Schema Object's treatment of default values, because in those cases parameter values are optional. If the enum is defined, the value MUST exist in the enum's values.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: An optional description for the server variable. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: schemas
fixedFields.description: An object to hold reusable Schema Objects.

fixedFields.name: responses
fixedFields.description: An object to hold reusable Response Objects.

fixedFields.name: parameters
fixedFields.description: An object to hold reusable Parameter Objects.

fixedFields.name: examples
fixedFields.description: An object to hold reusable Example Objects.

fixedFields.name: requestBodies
fixedFields.description: An object to hold reusable Request Body Objects.

fixedFields.name: headers
fixedFields.description: An object to hold reusable Header Objects.

fixedFields.name: securitySchemes
fixedFields.description: An object to hold reusable Security Scheme Objects.

fixedFields.name: links
fixedFields.description: An object to hold reusable Link Objects.

fixedFields.name: callbacks
fixedFields.description: An object to hold reusable Callback Objects.

fixedFields.name: pathItems
fixedFields.description: An object to hold reusable Path Item Object.

fixedFields.name: $ref
fixedFields.description: Allows for a referenced definition of this path item. The referenced structure MUST be in the form of a Path Item Object.  In case a Path Item Object field appears both in the defined object and the referenced object, the behavior is undefined. See the rules for resolving Relative References.

fixedFields.name: summary
fixedFields.description: An optional, string summary, intended to apply to all operations in this path.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: An optional, string description, intended to apply to all operations in this path. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: get
fixedFields.description: A definition of a GET operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: put
fixedFields.description: A definition of a PUT operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: post
fixedFields.description: A definition of a POST operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: delete
fixedFields.description: A definition of a DELETE operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: options
fixedFields.description: A definition of a OPTIONS operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: head
fixedFields.description: A definition of a HEAD operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: patch
fixedFields.description: A definition of a PATCH operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: trace
fixedFields.description: A definition of a TRACE operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: servers
fixedFields.description: An alternative server array to service all operations in this path.

fixedFields.name: parameters
fixedFields.description: A list of parameters that are applicable for all the operations described under this path. These parameters can be overridden at the operation level, but cannot be removed there. The list MUST NOT include duplicated parameters. A unique parameter is defined by a combination of a name and location. The list can use the Reference Object to link to parameters that are defined at the OpenAPI Object's components/parameters.

fixedFields.name: tags
fixedFields.description: A list of tags for API documentation control. Tags can be used for logical grouping of operations by resources or any other qualifier.

fixedFields.name: summary
fixedFields.description: A short summary of what the operation does.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A verbose explanation of the operation behavior. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: externalDocs
fixedFields.description: Additional external documentation for this operation.

fixedFields.name: operationId
fixedFields.description: Unique string used to identify the operation. The id MUST be unique among all operations described in the API. The operationId value is case-sensitive. Tools and libraries MAY use the operationId to uniquely identify an operation, therefore, it is RECOMMENDED to follow common programming naming conventions.

fixedFields.name: parameters
fixedFields.description: A list of parameters that are applicable for this operation. If a parameter is already defined at the Path Item, the new definition will override it but can never remove it. The list MUST NOT include duplicated parameters. A unique parameter is defined by a combination of a name and location. The list can use the Reference Object to link to parameters that are defined at the OpenAPI Object's components/parameters.

fixedFields.name: requestBody
fixedFields.description: The request body applicable for this operation.  The requestBody is fully supported in HTTP methods where the HTTP 1.1 specification RFC7231 has explicitly defined semantics for request bodies.  In other cases where the HTTP spec is vague (such as GET, HEAD and DELETE), requestBody is permitted but does not have well-defined semantics and SHOULD be avoided if possible.

fixedFields.name: responses
fixedFields.description: The list of possible responses as they are returned from executing this operation.

fixedFields.name: callbacks
fixedFields.description: A map of possible out-of band callbacks related to the parent operation. The key is a unique identifier for the Callback Object. Each value in the map is a Callback Object that describes a request that may be initiated by the API provider and the expected responses.

fixedFields.name: deprecated
fixedFields.description: Declares this operation to be deprecated. Consumers SHOULD refrain from usage of the declared operation. Default value is false.

fixedFields.name: security
fixedFields.description: A declaration of which security mechanisms can be used for this operation. The list of values includes alternative security requirement objects that can be used. Only one of the security requirement objects need to be satisfied to authorize a request. To make security optional, an empty security requirement ({}) can be included in the array. This definition overrides any declared top-level security. To remove a top-level security declaration, an empty array can be used.

fixedFields.name: servers
fixedFields.description: An alternative server array to service this operation. If an alternative server object is specified at the Path Item Object or Root level, it will be overridden by this value.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A description of the target documentation. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: url
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The URL for the target documentation. This MUST be in the form of a URL.

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The name of the parameter. Parameter names are case sensitive. If in is "path", the name field MUST correspond to a template expression occurring within the path field in the Paths Object. See Path Templating for further information.If in is "header" and the name field is "Accept", "Content-Type" or "Authorization", the parameter definition SHALL be ignored.For all other cases, the name corresponds to the parameter name used by the in property.

fixedFields.name: in
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The location of the parameter. Possible values are "query", "header", "path" or "cookie".

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: required
fixedFields.description: Determines whether this parameter is mandatory. If the parameter location is "path", this property is REQUIRED and its value MUST be true. Otherwise, the property MAY be included and its default value is false.

fixedFields.name: deprecated
fixedFields.description: Specifies that a parameter is deprecated and SHOULD be transitioned out of usage. Default value is false.

fixedFields.name: allowEmptyValue
fixedFields.description: Sets the ability to pass empty-valued parameters. This is valid only for query parameters and allows sending a parameter with an empty value. Default value is false. If style is used, and if behavior is n/a (cannot be serialized), the value of allowEmptyValue SHALL be ignored. Use of this property is NOT RECOMMENDED, as it is likely to be removed in a later revision.

fixedFields.name: style
fixedFields.description: Describes how the parameter value will be serialized depending on the type of the parameter value. Default values (based on value of in): for query - form; for path - simple; for header - simple; for cookie - form.

fixedFields.name: explode
fixedFields.description: When this is true, parameter values of type array or object generate separate parameters for each value of the array or key-value pair of the map. For other types of parameters this property has no effect. When style is form, the default value is true. For all other styles, the default value is false.

fixedFields.name: allowReserved
fixedFields.description: Determines whether the parameter value SHOULD allow reserved characters, as defined by RFC3986 :/?#[]@!$&'()*+,;= to be included without percent-encoding. This property only applies to parameters with an in value of query. The default value is false.

fixedFields.name: schema
fixedFields.description: The schema defining the type used for the parameter.

fixedFields.name: example
fixedFields.description: Example of the parameter's potential value. The example SHOULD match the specified schema and encoding properties if present. The example field is mutually exclusive of the examples field. Furthermore, if referencing a schema that contains an example, the example value SHALL override the example provided by the schema. To represent examples of media types that cannot naturally be represented in JSON or YAML, a string value can contain the example with escaping where necessary.

fixedFields.name: examples
fixedFields.description: Examples of the parameter's potential value. Each example SHOULD contain a value in the correct format as specified in the parameter encoding. The examples field is mutually exclusive of the example field. Furthermore, if referencing a schema that contains an example, the examples value SHALL override the example provided by the schema.

fixedFields.name: content
fixedFields.description: A map containing the representations for the parameter. The key is the media type and the value describes it. The map MUST only contain one entry.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A brief description of the request body. This could contain examples of use.  CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: content
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The content of the request body. The key is a media type or media type range and the value describes it.  For requests that match multiple keys, only the most specific key is applicable. e.g. text/plain overrides text/*

fixedFields.name: required
fixedFields.description: Determines if the request body is required in the request. Defaults to false.

fixedFields.name: schema
fixedFields.description: The schema defining the content of the request, response, or parameter.

fixedFields.name: example
fixedFields.description: Example of the media type.  The example object SHOULD be in the correct format as specified by the media type.  The example field is mutually exclusive of the examples field.  Furthermore, if referencing a schema which contains an example, the example value SHALL override the example provided by the schema.

fixedFields.name: examples
fixedFields.description: Examples of the media type.  Each example object SHOULD  match the media type and specified schema if present.  The examples field is mutually exclusive of the example field.  Furthermore, if referencing a schema which contains an example, the examples value SHALL override the example provided by the schema.

fixedFields.name: encoding
fixedFields.description: A map between a property name and its encoding information. The key, being the property name, MUST exist in the schema as a property. The encoding object SHALL only apply to requestBody objects when the media type is multipart or application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

fixedFields.name: contentType
fixedFields.description: The Content-Type for encoding a specific property. Default value depends on the property type: for object - application/json;  for array – the default is defined based on the inner type; for all other cases the default is application/octet-stream. The value can be a specific media type (e.g. application/json), a wildcard media type (e.g. image/*), or a comma-separated list of the two types.

fixedFields.name: headers
fixedFields.description: A map allowing additional information to be provided as headers, for example Content-Disposition.  Content-Type is described separately and SHALL be ignored in this section. This property SHALL be ignored if the request body media type is not a multipart.

fixedFields.name: style
fixedFields.description: Describes how a specific property value will be serialized depending on its type.  See Parameter Object for details on the style property. The behavior follows the same values as query parameters, including default values. This property SHALL be ignored if the request body media type is not application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data. If a value is explicitly defined, then the value of contentType (implicit or explicit) SHALL be ignored.

fixedFields.name: explode
fixedFields.description: When this is true, property values of type array or object generate separate parameters for each value of the array, or key-value-pair of the map.  For other types of properties this property has no effect. When style is form, the default value is true. For all other styles, the default value is false. This property SHALL be ignored if the request body media type is not application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data. If a value is explicitly defined, then the value of contentType (implicit or explicit) SHALL be ignored.

fixedFields.name: allowReserved
fixedFields.description: Determines whether the parameter value SHOULD allow reserved characters, as defined by RFC3986 :/?#[]@!$&'()*+,;= to be included without percent-encoding. The default value is false. This property SHALL be ignored if the request body media type is not application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data. If a value is explicitly defined, then the value of contentType (implicit or explicit) SHALL be ignored.

fixedFields.name: default
fixedFields.description: The documentation of responses other than the ones declared for specific HTTP response codes. Use this field to cover undeclared responses.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. A description of the response. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: headers
fixedFields.description: Maps a header name to its definition. RFC7230 states header names are case insensitive. If a response header is defined with the name "Content-Type", it SHALL be ignored.

fixedFields.name: content
fixedFields.description: A map containing descriptions of potential response payloads. The key is a media type or media type range and the value describes it.  For responses that match multiple keys, only the most specific key is applicable. e.g. text/plain overrides text/*

fixedFields.name: links
fixedFields.description: A map of operations links that can be followed from the response. The key of the map is a short name for the link, following the naming constraints of the names for Component Objects.

fixedFields.name: summary
fixedFields.description: Short description for the example.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: Long description for the example. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: value
fixedFields.description: Embedded literal example. The value field and externalValue field are mutually exclusive. To represent examples of media types that cannot naturally represented in JSON or YAML, use a string value to contain the example, escaping where necessary.

fixedFields.name: externalValue
fixedFields.description: A URI that points to the literal example. This provides the capability to reference examples that cannot easily be included in JSON or YAML documents.  The value field and externalValue field are mutually exclusive. See the rules for resolving Relative References.

fixedFields.name: operationRef
fixedFields.description: A relative or absolute URI reference to an OAS operation. This field is mutually exclusive of the operationId field, and MUST point to an Operation Object. Relative operationRef values MAY be used to locate an existing Operation Object in the OpenAPI definition. See the rules for resolving Relative References.

fixedFields.name: operationId
fixedFields.description: The name of an existing, resolvable OAS operation, as defined with a unique operationId.  This field is mutually exclusive of the operationRef field.

fixedFields.name: parameters
fixedFields.description: A map representing parameters to pass to an operation as specified with operationId or identified via operationRef. The key is the parameter name to be used, whereas the value can be a constant or an expression to be evaluated and passed to the linked operation.  The parameter name can be qualified using the parameter location [{in}.]{name} for operations that use the same parameter name in different locations (e.g. path.id).

fixedFields.name: requestBody
fixedFields.description: A literal value or {expression} to use as a request body when calling the target operation.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A description of the link. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: server
fixedFields.description: A server object to be used by the target operation.

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The name of the tag.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A description for the tag. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: externalDocs
fixedFields.description: Additional external documentation for this tag.

fixedFields.name: $ref
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The reference identifier. This MUST be in the form of a URI.

fixedFields.name: summary
fixedFields.description: A short summary which by default SHOULD override that of the referenced component. If the referenced object-type does not allow a summary field, then this field has no effect.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A description which by default SHOULD override that of the referenced component. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation. If the referenced object-type does not allow a description field, then this field has no effect.

fixedFields.name: discriminator
fixedFields.description: Adds support for polymorphism. The discriminator is an object name that is used to differentiate between other schemas which may satisfy the payload description. See Composition and Inheritance for more details.

fixedFields.name: xml
fixedFields.description: This MAY be used only on properties schemas. It has no effect on root schemas. Adds additional metadata to describe the XML representation of this property.

fixedFields.name: externalDocs
fixedFields.description: Additional external documentation for this schema.

fixedFields.name: example
fixedFields.description: A free-form property to include an example of an instance for this schema. To represent examples that cannot be naturally represented in JSON or YAML, a string value can be used to contain the example with escaping where necessary.Deprecated: The example property has been deprecated in favor of the JSON Schema examples keyword. Use of example is discouraged, and later versions of this specification may remove it.

fixedFields.name: propertyName
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The name of the property in the payload that will hold the discriminator value.

fixedFields.name: mapping
fixedFields.description: An object to hold mappings between payload values and schema names or references.

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: Replaces the name of the element/attribute used for the described schema property. When defined within items, it will affect the name of the individual XML elements within the list. When defined alongside type being array (outside the items), it will affect the wrapping element and only if wrapped is true. If wrapped is false, it will be ignored.

fixedFields.name: namespace
fixedFields.description: The URI of the namespace definition. This MUST be in the form of an absolute URI.

fixedFields.name: prefix
fixedFields.description: The prefix to be used for the name.

fixedFields.name: attribute
fixedFields.description: Declares whether the property definition translates to an attribute instead of an element. Default value is false.

fixedFields.name: wrapped
fixedFields.description: MAY be used only for an array definition. Signifies whether the array is wrapped (for example, <books><book/><book/></books>) or unwrapped (<book/><book/>). Default value is false. The definition takes effect only when defined alongside type being array (outside the items).

fixedFields.name: type
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The type of the security scheme. Valid values are "apiKey", "http", "mutualTLS", "oauth2", "openIdConnect".

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A description for security scheme. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The name of the header, query or cookie parameter to be used.

fixedFields.name: in
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The location of the API key. Valid values are "query", "header" or "cookie".

fixedFields.name: scheme
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The name of the HTTP Authorization scheme to be used in the Authorization header as defined in RFC7235.  The values used SHOULD be registered in the IANA Authentication Scheme registry.

fixedFields.name: bearerFormat
fixedFields.description: A hint to the client to identify how the bearer token is formatted.  Bearer tokens are usually generated by an authorization server, so this information is primarily for documentation purposes.

fixedFields.name: flows
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. An object containing configuration information for the flow types supported.

fixedFields.name: openIdConnectUrl
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. OpenId Connect URL to discover OAuth2 configuration values. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OpenID Connect standard requires the use of TLS.

fixedFields.name: implicit
fixedFields.description: Configuration for the OAuth Implicit flow

fixedFields.name: password
fixedFields.description: Configuration for the OAuth Resource Owner Password flow

fixedFields.name: clientCredentials
fixedFields.description: Configuration for the OAuth Client Credentials flow.  Previously called application in OpenAPI 2.0.

fixedFields.name: authorizationCode
fixedFields.description: Configuration for the OAuth Authorization Code flow.  Previously called accessCode in OpenAPI 2.0.

fixedFields.name: authorizationUrl
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The authorization URL to be used for this flow. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2 standard requires the use of TLS.

fixedFields.name: tokenUrl
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The token URL to be used for this flow. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2 standard requires the use of TLS.

fixedFields.name: refreshUrl
fixedFields.description: The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens. This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OAuth2 standard requires the use of TLS.

fixedFields.name: scopes
fixedFields.description: REQUIRED. The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme. A map between the scope name and a short description for it. The map MAY be empty.
